intro: Chytranthus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf chytranthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native habitat.
